title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not include an acceptable description. Acceptable descriptions include the following.

  • The population density will fluctuate.

  • The population will fluctuate around the carrying capacity.

The response includes an acceptable description. Acceptable descriptions include the following.

  • The population density will fluctuate.

  • The population will fluctuate around the carrying capacity.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not justify that the researchers’ performing their measurements in both early spring and summer allowed the scientists to see whether/how the diets of the copepods changed (with changing conditions).

The response justifies that the researchers’ performing their measurements in both early spring and summer allowed the scientists to see whether/how the diets of the copepods changed (with changing conditions).

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not state an acceptable null hypothesis. Acceptable null hypotheses include the following.

  • There is no (statistical) difference in diet among copepods of all sizes.

  • There is no difference in (mouthpart) adaptations between large-bodied and small‑bodied copepods.

  • The (mouth) adaptations of a copepod do not correlate with the copepod’s diet.

  • The mouthpart carnivory score of a copepod does not correlate with the copepod’s diet.

  • The time of year does not correlate with diet.

The response states an acceptable null hypothesis. Acceptable null hypotheses include the following.

  • There is no (statistical) difference in diet among copepods of all sizes.

  • There is no difference in (mouthpart) adaptations between large-bodied and small‑bodied copepods.

  • The (mouth) adaptations of a copepod do not correlate with the copepod’s diet.

  • The mouthpart carnivory score of a copepod does not correlate with the copepod’s diet.

  • The time of year does not correlate with diet.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not include the support that (if the ponds dry up) the algae will die, so the copepods (that have a lower mouthpart carnivory score) will die before they have a chance to lay eggs.
The response includes the support that (if the ponds dry up) the algae will die, so the copepods (that have a lower mouthpart carnivory score) will die before they have a chance to lay eggs.
